alert.note: Alert for Copiah (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 5:11PM CDT until March 26 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN HINDS AND NORTHWESTERN COPIAH COUNTIES... At 511 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Dentville, or 12 miles west of Crystal Springs, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Dry Grove around 525 PM CDT. Terry around 535 PM CDT. Jackson and Byram around 545 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Learned. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and southwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
